message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI

This paper is likely to belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category as it deals with natural language processing and text summarization. It also involves topic modeling, which is a common technique used in this sub-category. 

It could also belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it involves ranking and selecting relevant sentences from a corpus of news articles. 

The paper's use of a hierarchical model and machine learning techniques make it a good fit for the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. 

The use of topic modeling and natural language processing techniques also make it a possible fit for the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper's focus on summarizing news events and detecting evolving patterns could make it relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
